designScenario.name: Fluid Distribution System
designScenario.description: The Fluid Distribution System is designed to precisely manage the delivery of multiple critical fluids (fuel, hydraulic, de-icing, and lubrication) across an aircraft's systems. It ensures controlled flow rates, pressures, and fluid routing via an integrated network of pumps, valves, sensors, and control modules. The system employs adaptive control algorithms, real-time monitoring, and redundant pathways to maintain operational integrity under extreme temperatures, altitude, and fault conditions, while complying with FAA/EASA safety and performance standards.

details.description: The system shall dynamically route and regulate fluid flow to designated systems (e.g., engines, landing gear, wings) based on real-time operational demands.
The system shall support selective activation of fluid delivery pathways for different fluid types (e.g., fuel, hydraulic fluid, de-icing fluid).
The system must maintain fluid pressure within 3-8 bar and achieve flow rates up to 150 L/min under standard operational conditions.
Fluid temperature must be regulated between -40°C to 80°C to ensure viscosity compatibility with aircraft systems.
The system must incorporate triple redundancy in critical fluid pathways (e.g., pumps, valves) to ensure uninterrupted operation under single-point failures.
Automated leak detection and isolation mechanisms must activate within 5 seconds of detecting fluid pressure drops exceeding 10% of nominal values.
All fluid reservoirs, pumps, and valves must be accessible via standardized quick-release connectors for rapid maintenance and fluid replenishment.
Diagnostic interfaces must provide real-time status updates and fault codes compliant with ARINC 661 standards.

systemComponents.name: Fluid Distribution System
systemComponents.description: Central subsystem managing fluid distribution across aircraft systems through integrated pumps, valves, sensors, and control modules.

subComponents.name: Fluid Pump Module
subComponents.description: Modular unit containing pumps and motors for pressurizing and delivering fluids to target systems.

subComponents.name: Centrifugal Pump
subComponents.description: High-pressure pump designed for variable fluid viscosity and temperature ranges.

subComponents.name: Electric Motor
subComponents.description: Brushless DC motor providing variable speed control for pump operation.

subComponents.name: Valve Control Unit
subComponents.description: Network of solenoid valves and actuators regulating fluid flow direction and volume.

subComponents.name: Solenoid Valve
subComponents.description: Electrically controlled valve for precise fluid pathway activation.

subComponents.name: Actuator Assembly
subComponents.description: Mechanical linkage system for synchronized valve operation.

subComponents.name: Fluid Reservoir
subComponents.description: Primary storage tank with level sensors and pressurization ports for fluid containment and delivery.

subComponents.name: Sensor Array
subComponents.description: Integrated sensors monitoring pressure, flow rate, temperature, and fluid level across the distribution network.

subComponents.name: Pressure Sensor
subComponents.description: Transducer measuring fluid pressure in real time.

subComponents.name: Flow Sensor
subComponents.description: Electromagnetic sensor tracking fluid flow velocity.

subComponents.name: Level Sensor
subComponents.description: Capacitive sensor detecting fluid levels in reservoirs.

subComponents.name: Control Module
subComponents.description: Centralized control unit processing sensor data and executing fluid distribution commands.

subComponents.name: Controller Unit
subComponents.description: Microprocessor-based controller running fluid distribution algorithms.

subComponents.name: User Interface
subComponents.description: Display panel for system status monitoring and manual override controls.

relationships.description: The Fluid Distribution System is composed of the Fluid Pump Module for pressurizing fluids.
The Fluid Distribution System is composed of the Valve Control Unit for fluid pathway regulation.
The Fluid Distribution System is composed of the Sensor Array for real-time monitoring.
The Fluid Distribution System is composed of the Control Module for centralized command execution.
The Fluid Pump Module is composed of the Centrifugal Pump for fluid pressurization.
The Valve Control Unit is composed of the Solenoid Valve for pathway control.
The Control Module depends on the Sensor Array for operational data input.

attributes.name: operationalPressureRange
attributes.description: Pressure range maintained by the system for fluid distribution.

attributes.name: maxFlowRate
attributes.description: Maximum flow rate achievable under standard operating conditions.

attributes.name: materialSpecification
attributes.description: Corrosion-resistant materials used in high-stress components.

attributes.name: redundancyLevel
attributes.description: Redundancy level applied to critical fluid pathways and actuators.

attributes.name: certification
attributes.description: Compliance with aviation safety and performance standards.

attributes.name: pumpMaxRPM
attributes.description: Maximum rotational speed of the Centrifugal Pump.

attributes.name: valveResponseTime
attributes.description: Maximum response time for valve actuation commands.

attributes.name: sensorAccuracy
attributes.description: Accuracy tolerance for pressure and flow sensors.

constraintBlocks.name: FluidOperationalConstraint
constraintBlocks.expression: operationalPressureRange must be between 3-8 bar and maxFlowRate <= 150 L/min

constraintBlocks.name: RedundancyConstraint
constraintBlocks.expression: redundancyLevel must be Triple for critical components

comments.body: Central system managing fluid distribution with adaptive control and triple redundancy
